## Main purpose and functionality

The purpose of the `platform_hal_GetHardware_MemFree` function in the RDK HAL component is to retrieve the total amount of free memory of the Dynamic Random Access Memory (DRAM) of the system.

## Key operations and data flow

The function takes a single parameter, `pValue`, which is a pointer to a character array. The function will store the total free memory size in the character array pointed to by `pValue`.

The function first checks to make sure that the `pValue` parameter is not NULL. If it is, the function returns an error code. Otherwise, the function calls the `platform_hal_GetFreeMemorySize` function to retrieve the total free memory size. The function then stores the free memory size in the character array pointed to by `pValue`.

## Interaction with other components

The `platform_hal_GetHardware_MemFree` function does not interact with any other components.

## Important parameters and return values

The following table describes the important parameters and return values of the `platform_hal_GetHardware_MemFree` function.

| Parameter | Description |
|---|---|
| `pValue` | A pointer to a character array to store the total free memory size |
| Return value | An error code if the function fails, or RETURN_OK if the function succeeds |

## Any specific RDK-related operations

The `platform_hal_GetHardware_MemFree` function is not specific to RDK. It can be used in any embedded system that uses the RDK HAL component.
